Package ui

Class MenuOption

java.lang.Object
ui.MenuOption
public class MenuOption extends Object
Datastructure used by OptionMenu representing an option that can be chosen in a menu. Contains a String for the name of the option, and a RunnableSelectOption for a callback function that runs whenever the option is selected.

The callback function will determine if the menu will close or stay open and restart via its result of MenuState

The callback can be added via method chaining, like seen in OptionMenu

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Isaac Fleetwood
See Also:
OptionMenu, MenuOptionConditional

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      Function used for determining if the option is visible.

      If addVisibilityCondition(RunnableCheckCondition) was not ran during object creation, it will always return true. Otherwise, if it was ran, it will determine visiblity based on the result of the visibility condition.

      Returns:
      Boolean for whether the option is visible or not.
